text: ^^ I’m going to Pitch Black tonight. Bummed that I will miss most of Little Friday. If anyone else wants to go, buy a ticket quickly - it’s almost sold out

<http://www.npr.org/sections/codeswitch/2016/08/25/455470334/all-mixed-up-what-do-we-call-people-of-multiple-backgrounds>

attachments.title: All Mixed Up: What Do We Call People Of Multiple Backgrounds?
attachments.text: The share of multiracial children in America has multiplied tenfold in the past 50 years. It's a good time to take stock of our shared vocabulary when it comes to describing Americans like me.
attachments.fallback: NPR.org: All Mixed Up: What Do We Call People Of Multiple Backgrounds?

text: Really great conversation to have. I've always said I'm half Chinese because that's what people are usually interested in.
same

For me it depends on context, somewhat. The constant is that there are a lot of different ways that I identify myself racially. I’ve learned to be comfortable with the fact that the vast majority of the time people misidentify me and that nobody else’s gaze is more important than my own.
i think its interesting that a lot of the mixed-race people i know identify more with their non-white heritage
I always find that strange, but I think it’s especially common among mixed API folks.
It’s for sure very different for people with a white parent vs. people with both parents PoC
yes
and i would wager (although i dont know personally) that if my white parent had a stronger cultural heritage I would feel differently. But my mom and her side of the family are pretty americanized.
though i did eat a lot of pasta and eggplant parm as a kid.
My niece at a young age started calling herself “syrupy” which nobody knew where she got it. But the family doesn’t talk about her parent’s different races, so she came up with her own word.
that is equal parts cute and heartbreaking
haha aw

the tech diversity pledge survey had race results that added up to greater than 100%, as a symptom of this. also i was glaring at a business survey inquiring what kind of racial minority owned uncorked with a single-select dropdown. But we’re MULTIPLE KINES!
i tell people that i'm 1/2 japanese and 1/2 japanese-american, which always gets a lot of confused looks
but they are very different!  culturally
i’m an alien tbh
I think a measure more nuanced than percentages is necessary for race. That is, I experience both being white and API at the same time, not each 50%
<@U243UT96G> - especially true for JAs who are of the first wave of migration (i.e. of the incarceration experience) vs. second wave
and third wave? is there a third wave? Maybe third trickle...

there is definitely a third wave brewing in japan, considering how much the PORTLAND thing is marketed over there!  seriously, japanese ppl are coming here in droves in search of hoppy beer / coffee / artisinal whatnot
<http://www.pdxmonthly.com/slideshows/2016/5/25/peek-inside-tokyo-s-new-portland-themed-taproom>

attachments.title: Peek inside Tokyo's New Portland-Themed Taproom
attachments.text: A Japanese shrine to Portland gets serious about our beer.
